Title:
Nematophagous fungus, proposal as a new genus, isolated from
Meloidogyne spp. and soils of Colombia (South America).
Keywords:
Fungal Biology, Fungal Taxonomy, Fungal Phylogeny, Fungal
ADNr, Fungal β-tubulin, Paecilomyces lilacinus.
Abstract:
The research is a Thesis degree(Ph.D) and describes the
studies that were carried out with the fungus strain named Cenicafé
9501. Such studies allowed formulating the hypothesis that it was a new
organism. A phylogenetic study was made using ADNr and ß tubulin,
constructing for it data bases that contained individual and combined
fragments, with sequences of fungi coming from international
publications or reference laboratories. In order to work with a
genetically homogenous fungus, monosporic cultures were done from which
one was chosen, to come to make the amplification by PCR of interest
fragments and the phylogenetic analysis. The nature of the fungus forced
to make descriptive morphological studies that allowed to identify it
and to establish their conidiogénesis in sequential form. Also,
preliminary tests were developed about the growth of the fungus in some
culture media that served as a base for other morphologic studies that
went developed later. In the other hand, were cloned genes
differentially expressed, during the in vitro interaction of the fungi
strain Cenicafé 9501 with eggs of Meloidogyne incognita and M. javanica,
in two different times (24-48 hours), which allowed to generate four (4)
libraries of DNAc to make the annotation of the genes, which made us to
determine the functional similarity with other existing ones in the
network. Within the similarities that were observed in the worked data
bases, it was possible to find, among others, genes related to primary
metabolism, mechanisms of transport, synthesis and folding of proteins,
as well as some possibly involved in the pathogenicity. To the being
compared with the existing sequences in the data bases, were some with
functional identity, even though the great majority of the worked
sequences did not shown identities or its function was not known.
